title: AML Soap
author: AML Soap
content: We have a massive amount of current buzz and energy surrounding Bitcoin and the crypto ecosystem. Do you talk to people offline about it, or tend to keep quiet for any number of reasons? Are Bitcoin and related topics currently the most exciting thing in your life? ("Optional") if No, what do you have going on that is more exciting?

comments.author: Ambatman
comments.body: No, Family. But coming to the Forum and checking prices by Chartbuddy is among the exciting things I engage in this past week. Seeing Green candles always and breaking ATH like this is quite a first to me because I wasn't really active during the 2021 Pump. It's a beautiful feel getting Richer and quite exciting if I may ask. While doing almost nothing.

comments.author: Pandorak
comments.body: Quote from: AML Soap on November 15, 2024, 10:16:19 PMWe have a massive amount of current buzz and energy surrounding Bitcoin and the crypto ecosystem. Do you talk to people offline about it, or tend to keep quiet for any number of reasons? Are Bitcoin and related topics currently the most exciting thing in your life? [...]Yes, i talked about it with all my surroundings. Starting from my family & friends hanging out. I think they should know about bitcoin and what is around it, i think it can help them to benefit from this financial revolution. Even thoughi got rejected several times by saying that bitcoin is a scam & this is a ponzi business, i did not give up to tell them that what they think about bitcoin is wrong.

comments.author: Fiatless
comments.body: Quote from: AML Soap on November 15, 2024, 10:16:19 PMWe have a massive amount of current buzz and energy surrounding Bitcoin and the crypto ecosystem. Do you talk to people offline about it, or tend to keep quiet for any number of reasons? Are Bitcoin and related topics currently the most exciting thing in your life? ("Optional") if No, what do you have going on that is more exciting?Bitcoin is just part of the financial part of my life and nothing more. I don't talk to people about Bitcoin outside the forum for security reasons. People usually think that you are rich if you own Bitcoin. It is also believed by some people that cryptos are scams or Ponzi schemes. So people tend to think you want to scam them if you start discussing with them.The well-being of my immediate and extended family is my highest priority. So the most exciting part of my life is to see them in good health and having enough resources to survive. I also want to see positive changes in the political system of my country. Engaging in lobbying and protest for the respect of people's fundamental rights is also an exciting endeavor.

comments.author: fuguebtc
comments.body: Quote from: Pandorak on November 16, 2024, 11:02:19 AMQuote from: AML Soap on November 15, 2024, 10:16:19 PMWe have a massive amount of current buzz and energy surrounding Bitcoin and the crypto ecosystem. Do you talk to people offline about it, or tend to keep quiet for any number of reasons? Are Bitcoin and related topics currently the most exciting thing in your life? [...]Yes, i talked about it with all my surroundings. Starting from my family & friends hanging out. I think they should know about bitcoin and what is around it, i think it can help them to benefit from this financial revolution. Even thoughi got rejected several times by saying that bitcoin is a scam & this is a ponzi business, i did not give up to tell them that what they think about bitcoin is wrong.I know you have good  intentions in trying to share with people about bitcoin because people who invest properly in bitcoin will have the opportunity to improve their lives .  But I think if they are not interested in bitcoin and are skeptical about what you say , you don't need to keep telling them about bitcoin . Not only will it not benefit you , it can also get you into trouble .Have you ever thought about what would happen if their investment didn't turn out as expected and they started blaming you? Or if bitcoin is not legal in your country, you may face risks when giving investment advice to people...I'm not against introducing bitcoin to people around me because I do it sometimes but if they're not interested, I'll never introduce bitcoin to them again . Instead, I will only share with those who really need it.

comments.author: BIT-BENDER
comments.body: Never make anything more important than your mental health and peace of mind. You need to find peace and comfort with yourself first and then with people around you. You can make Bitcoin your number one priority you won't have the clear mental stability to carry on Yes I discuss Bitcoin especially with those who share same enthusiasm. I do talk to Bitcoin to novice but I watch my words I always try not to give feedback financial advice raw, I let them do their research and be accountable for any Bitcoin decision they make.

comments.author: Felicity_Tide
comments.body: Quote from: AML Soap on November 15, 2024, 10:16:19 PMWe have a massive amount of current buzz and energy surrounding Bitcoin and the crypto ecosystem. Do you talk to people offline about it, or tend to keep quiet for any number of reasons?I only have such Bitcoin and other related conversations with those that know about them. You don't expect me to start a conversation with someone who doesn't have a single idea. Since conversation has to be two sided, I expect the other person that I'm talking with to respond back. And I don't just have conversation with anyone that understands Bitcoin, but with those that understands, and are very close.QuoteAre Bitcoin and related topics currently the most exciting thing in your life? ("Optional") if No, what do you have going on that is more exciting?Not at all.Quality time around love ones is probably the best thing ever. Though, spending time to grasp the whole Bitcoin and it's implementation can be very interesting, but quality time around people is still a major priority.

comments.author: ultrloa
comments.body: Quote from: AML Soap on November 15, 2024, 10:16:19 PMWe have a massive amount of current buzz and energy surrounding Bitcoin and the crypto ecosystem. Do you talk to people offline about it, or tend to keep quiet for any number of reasons? Are Bitcoin and related topics currently the most exciting thing in your life? ("Optional") if No, what do you have going on that is more exciting?I only talk crypto on people who also know about it since for sure that discussion will be so educating since we could learn a lot from experience of other people.But for people doesn't know about it? I keep silent since its kinda energy draining especially if you try to explain bitcoin to them and present the possible life changing opportunity on their faces, but they turn down these things because what they say bitcoin is scam. For sure that we cannot get anything from these people and we are just wasting our time with them. That's why I am so selective when picking up discussions in related on bitcoin since I don't want to receive negative impression about what I possibly tell to them.

comments.author: sunsilk
comments.body: Quote from: AML Soap on November 15, 2024, 10:16:19 PMWe have a massive amount of current buzz and energy surrounding Bitcoin and the crypto ecosystem. Do you talk to people offline about it, or tend to keep quiet for any number of reasons? Are Bitcoin and related topics currently the most exciting thing in your life? As much as I want to be silent about it, my friends that I have talked to before will come by just to discuss things about Bitcoin. I'm no longer the same as before when I'd always want to open up to everyone about Bitcoin, but not any more today.But if someone approaches me and wants to talk about it, I'll just obliged myself to answer and talk about it because I'm happy to see my co-bitcoiner personally and yes, that makes me more excited.

comments.author: Plaguedeath
comments.body: Definitely Bitcoin is the most exciting thing in my life, but I don't talk with other people about that, I hold it in myself. There's no way the gain in Bitcoin will not make me excited since most of my wealth is in Bitcoin.What make me excited is finding a way to make more money and money, for now I've thinking to convert my Bitcoin to stablecoin, stake my stablecoin, then wait for it until bear season, that's the time I will accumulate Bitcoin and use some amount to gamble on shitcoins.

comments.author: apogio
comments.body: Bitcoin is nothing but a tool. The excitement comes when we realize that we have a tool to fight the current financial system which, by definition, leads to inequality. Bitcoin is exciting because we get to actually hold our own money.Bitcoin is exciting because we need no third party in our financial life.So, Bitcoin is not more exciting when it costs $80k than when it costs $20k.My friends don't know my holdings, but they do know that I have a solid technical knowledge regarding Bitcoin. I talk about it as a strong medium to fight financial surveillance, but not as a "invest in bitcoin" medium. Most people (my friends included), have no idea what bitcoin is, but they only "see" it when it goes up in price.I don't discuss with my friends about bitcoin, because I hate this mentality.It's the exact same mentality that people investing in shitcoins have. It's a "get rich quick" mentality, rather than a "I found a tool to become financially free" mentality.

comments.author: dzungmobile
comments.body: Quote from: AML Soap on November 15, 2024, 10:16:19 PMWe have a massive amount of current buzz and energy surrounding Bitcoin and the crypto ecosystem. Do you talk to people offline about it, or tend to keep quiet for any number of reasons? Are Bitcoin and related topics currently the most exciting thing in your life? When many people around you, change from lacked of interest in Bitcoin in many previous years, to very excited about Bitcoin now, it's early signal of Bitcoin market's euphoria phase. The top is not far and you must start to think more about taking profit. I am sure that you won't be able to time the market, find ATH to take profit but when you smell some signals of market top, it's not too bad to think of taking profit.Newbies with new capital will boost Bitcoin to its cycle top, and if you are not newbie, but experienced investor, you will take advantage of it to take profit.Are you ready for the Bitcoin bull market? What's your plan? Some ideas for you

comments.author: Cryptomultiplier
comments.body: Quote from: AML Soap on November 15, 2024, 10:16:19 PMWe have a massive amount of current buzz and energy surrounding Bitcoin and the crypto ecosystem. Do you talk to people offline about it, or tend to keep quiet for any number of reasons? Are Bitcoin and related topics currently the most exciting thing in your life? ("Optional") if No, what do you have going on that is more exciting?Some of buzz happens to be a ripple effect of the just concluded U.S elections, of which Trump who is a fan and supporter of cryptocurrency and Bitcoin in particular, won. The buzz also is as a result of more countries enabling crypto mining farms and going as far as removing taxes on cryptocurrency transactions, a country like the UAE, Costa Rica also having to adopt the use of Bitcoin ATM machines, and other numerous to count. The current price of Bitcoin is competing with the price of Gold currently and we might see it rise to $100k soonest.

comments.author: BlackHatCoiner
comments.body: Quote from: AML Soap on November 15, 2024, 10:16:19 PMDo you talk to people offline about it, or tend to keep quiet for any number of reasons?A little of both. I do try to be quiet most of the times, but I do talk a lot about it, when the conversation brings it. In general, I talk about it when people are interested. When they are not interested, it's like talking to the wall.QuoteAre Bitcoin and related topics currently the most exciting thing in your life?It is certainly the most intellectually stimulating part of my life. It's a fantastic concept, and I'm glad it was my generation that gets to experience it that early. There's no other subject that can challenge my mind to this extent, so it's pretty much exciting, yes.

comments.author: Darker45
comments.body: Man, life is about a hundred million things other than Bitcoin. So, no, Bitcoin isn't the most exciting thing in my life. What's more exciting? There are too many to mention.But, yeah, I talk to a handful of people about Bitcoin. For those who aren't close to me and who aren't closely following Bitcoin-related developments, I'd rather not talk about it. For family members who are also into Bitcoin, I can talk openly. There are also some close friends with whom I can talk about Bitcoin, but I never open it up as a topic to discuss.

comments.author: tbct_mt2
comments.body: Quote from: BlackHatCoiner on November 16, 2024, 01:41:48 PMA little of both. I do try to be quiet most of the times, but I do talk a lot about it, when the conversation brings it. In general, I talk about it when people are interested. When they are not interested, it's like talking to the wall.First and foremost, it is for your life security. Talking about Bitcoin is like informing others that you are a Bitcoin investor and you have bitcoin. It's risky for your life because there are reported Bitcoin physical attacks.Secondly it is like your said, if they are not interested in and you proactively knock their doors to talk about Bitcoin, it's like wasting your time to talk with a physical wall.People can learn about Bitcoin, online if they want, because there are many available resources, online and free for learning. They don't need to get a personal tutor to talk them about Bitcoin, especially basics.Learnmeabitcoin.com can help them to start.

comments.author: Reatim
comments.body: Quote from: AML Soap on November 15, 2024, 10:16:19 PMWe have a massive amount of current buzz and energy surrounding Bitcoin and the crypto ecosystem. Do you talk to people offline about it, or tend to keep quiet for any number of reasons?I do not know a lot of people offline that is into bitcoin so I don’t. I wouldn’t also want to talk about cryptocurrency to just about anyone I meet and reveal that I am holding some and is quite knowledgeable about crypto. Just being safe. QuoteAre Bitcoin and related topics currently the most exciting thing in your life? ("Optional") if No, what do you have going on that is more exciting?I am not going to lie. What is happening right now is exciting because I am seeing my money grow, but I don’t think you should rely all your excitement and happiness to money or crypto. What happens if the market dips, will you be depressed? We need to live a balanced life as well and not just be focused on one thing. Whether that is work or your partner, you can’t focus on just one. You need hobbies, time for friends, family, and for yourself. Plenty of things to be excited about in life.

comments.author: Ruttoshi
comments.body: I only talk about bitcoin in my house with my siblings because I want them to see a good reason why they need to invest on bitcoin for the future. I am the most excited that I came here to know about bitcoin and also took the bold step to invest, because it's worth more than an asset.However, I have a friend who wants to invest in bitcoin but he is not ready to hodli for long, whenever he comes to the house, I only do advice him to consider holding bitcoin for a long-term. Apart from this, I keep my mouth shut when I am out from the house.

comments.author: mindrust
comments.body: Of course. Bitcoin is making all time highs, doge is going crazy, some alts are also doing great. Crypto hodlers are printing money at the moment. I don’t know if there is anything else that can give me that kind of pleasure. Happiness is the secret of having a long healthy life and making money gives so much of it. I am sure that’s a common thing among many people. Most people live to make money and making more money makes us very very happy. Trump won, btc is mooning what else I could ask for… feelsgoodman

comments.author: Leahized
comments.body: I will say yes first. Because I think Bitcoin is like it was before. At present, the popularity has increased more than that. Not only that, if a person wants to change his life then he must invest in Bitcoin as it will have life security. For example, if someone invests in Bitcoin now, after two to three months, he will see 2x, 3x and 5x returns.But of course everyone should remember, hardware wallets should be used to hold bitcoins so that they are far away from the reach of hackers. Otherwise you can lose the hard earned money. By doing this, the risk to the investor's life may increase and may cause a lot of damage physically.Quote from: tbct_mt2 on November 16, 2024, 01:52:16 PMPeople can learn about Bitcoin, online if they want, because there are many available resources, online and free for learning. They don't need to get a personal tutor to talk them about Bitcoin, especially basics.Yes as you said many people can learn about bitcoins for free. But if they are more interested then learn in different ways like: Youtube, Twitter Etc. Because I think that bitcoin is the most popular nowadays, many bitcoin holders do their analysis and know about bitcoin. By doing this it will be very useful for those who are interested because they will understand and learn better.
